definitions.text: a lofty level or position or degree
examples: summer temperatures reached an all-time high

definitions.text: an air mass of higher than normal pressure
examples: the east coast benefits from a Bermuda high
I'm on a permanent high these days

definitions.text: a state of altered consciousness induced by alcohol or narcotics
examples: they took drugs to get a high on
they stood on high and observed the countryside

definitions.text: a public secondary school usually including grades 9 through 12
examples: he goes to the neighborhood highschool

definitions.text: a forward gear with a gear ratio that gives the greatest vehicle velocity for a given engine speed
greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount
examples: the high point of his career
he has a high opinion of himself

definitions.text: (literal meaning) being at or having a relatively great or specific elevation or upward extension (sometimes used in combinations like `knee-high')
standing above others in quality or position
used of sounds and voices; high in pitch or frequency
(used of the smell of meat) smelling spoiled or tainted
slightly and pleasantly intoxicated from alcohol or a drug (especially marijuana)

examples: he climbed high on the ladder

definitions.text: in or to a high position, amount, or degree
examples: prices have gone up far too high
he lives high up the river
